column2: Gather ingredients
Preheat griddle or skillet
Grease griddle or skillet
Sift dry ingredients (flour, sugar, baking powder, salt) into a bowl
In a separate bowl, whisk together wet ingredients (eggs, milk, melted butter)
Create a well in the center of the dry ingredients and pour in the wet ingredients
Gently fold wet and dry ingredients until just combined
Let batter rest for 5-10 minutes to allow gluten to relax
Heat griddle or skillet over medium heat
Ladle batter onto the griddle or skillet, using about 1/4 cup per pancake
Cook until bubbles form on the surface of the pancakes and the edges look set, about 2-3 minutes
Flip pancakes and cook until golden brown on the other side, about 2-3 minutes
Transfer cooked pancakes to a plate and keep warm while cooking remaining batter
Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C)
Prepare pie crust in a 9-inch (23 cm) pie dish
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat
Add chopped onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes
Add chopped spinach to the skillet and cook until wilted, about 3 minutes
In a large bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, salt, and pepper
Stir in crumbled feta cheese
Add cooked spinach mixture to the egg mixture and stir to combine
Pour the mixture into the prepared pie crust
Bake in the preheated oven until the quiche is set and the crust is golden brown, about 35-40 minutes
Allow the quiche to cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving
Prepare the beef tenderloin by trimming excess fat and tying with kitchen twine, if necessary
Season the beef generously with salt and pepper
Heat olive oil in a skillet over high heat
Sear the beef on all sides until browned, about 2 minutes per side
Remove the beef from the skillet and let it cool completely
Prepare the mushroom duxelles by finely chopping mushrooms, shallots, and garlic
Cook the mushroom mixture in the same skillet used for searing the beef until the moisture evaporates
Roll out puff pastry on a floured surface to a size large enough to wrap the beef
Spread a layer of pâté or mustard onto the puff pastry
Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C)
In a large mixing bowl, cream together softened butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy
Beat in eggs and vanilla extract until well combined
In a separate bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, and salt
Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined
Fold in chocolate chips until evenly distributed throughout the dough
Drop rounded tablespoons of dough onto ungreased baking sheets
Bake in the preheated oven for 8-10 minutes, or until the edges are golden brown
Soak rice noodles in warm water for 30 minutes
Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat
Add minced garlic and chopped shallots, cook until fragrant
Add diced chicken breast, cook until no longer pink
Push chicken to one side of the wok, crack eggs into the empty space
Scramble eggs until cooked through, then mix with chicken
Drain soaked rice noodles and add them to the wok
Pour in pad Thai sauce and toss until noodles are evenly coated
Add bean sprouts, sliced green onions, and chopped peanuts
Stir-fry until bean sprouts are tender but still crisp
Serve hot with lime wedges and additional peanuts on top
Prepare the dough by mixing flour, yeast, sugar, salt, and water in a large bowl
Knead the dough until smooth and elastic
Roll out the dough into a large rectangle on a floured surface
Spread softened butter over two-thirds of the dough rectangle
Fold the unbuttered third over the middle third, then fold the remaining third on top to create layers
Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 30 minutes
Remove the dough from the refrigerator and roll it out again into a large rectangle
Repeat the folding process (steps 4-5) two more times, chilling the dough for 30 minutes between each fold
After the final fold, wrap the dough and refrigerate overnight
The next day, roll out the dough into a large rectangle about 1/4 inch thick
Cut the dough into triangles and roll each triangle into a croissant shape
Place the shaped croissants on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper
Let the croissants proof at room temperature for 2-3 hours, until doubled in size
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C)
Brush the proofed croissants with egg wash
Bake the croissants in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, until golden brown
Allow the croissants to cool slightly before serving
Beat egg yolks and sugar until pale and creamy
Mix in mascarpone cheese until smooth
Whip egg whites until stiff peaks form, then fold into mascarpone mixture
Dip ladyfingers in coffee and arrange in a single layer in a dish
Spread half of the mascarpone mixture over the ladyfingers
Repeat layers with remaining ladyfingers and mascarpone mixture
Dust the top with cocoa powder and refrigerate for at least 4 hours or overnight
Cook sushi rice according to package instructions and let it cool
Lay a sheet of nori on a bamboo sushi mat
Spread rice over the nori, leaving a 1-inch border at the top
Arrange fillings (such as cucumber, avocado, and crab sticks) in a line across the center of the rice
Roll the sushi tightly using the bamboo mat, then slice into pieces
Prepare the filling by wilting spinach and mixing it with feta cheese, onions, and herbs
Melt butter and brush phyllo pastry sheets with melted butter
Layer phyllo sheets with the spinach and cheese mixture
Fold and roll the phyllo sheets into a log shape
Brush the top with more butter and bake until golden brown
Layer phyllo pastry sheets in a baking dish, brushing each layer with melted butter
Mix chopped nuts with sugar and spices, then spread over the phyllo layers
Continue layering phyllo and nuts until all ingredients are used
Cut the baklava into diamond or square shapes
Bake for 45 minutes to 1 hour, until golden brown
Beat eggs with a splash of milk, salt, and pepper
Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat until melted
Pour the egg mixture into the skillet and let it cook undisturbed until the edges are set
Gently lift the edges of the omelette and tilt the skillet to let the uncooked eggs flow underneath
Add fillings (such as cheese, vegetables, or ham) to one half of the omelette
Fold the other half of the omelette over the fillings and cook for another minute
Preheat the oven and pizza stone to the highest temperature possible
Roll out pizza dough on a floured surface into a circle
Spread tomato sauce over the dough, leaving a border around the edges
Arrange sliced fresh mozzarella and basil leaves on top of the sauce
Drizzle olive oil over the pizza and sprinkle with salt
Transfer the pizza to the preheated pizza stone and bake until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly
Grill or bake chicken breasts until cooked through, then slice into strips
Prepare Caesar dressing by mixing mayonnaise, anchovy paste, garlic, lemon juice, and Parmesan cheese
Toss chopped romaine lettuce with Caesar dressing until evenly coated
Add croutons, grated Parmesan cheese, and sliced grilled chicken to the salad
Prepare pie crust by mixing flour, salt, and butter until crumbly, then adding ice water until dough forms
Roll out half of the dough and line a pie dish with it
Mix sliced apples with sugar, cinnamon, and lemon juice, then pour into the pie crust
Roll out the remaining dough and place it over the apples, sealing the edges
Cut slits in the top crust to vent steam, then brush with egg wash
Bake in a preheated oven until the crust is golden brown and the filling is bubbling
Slice beef thinly against the grain and marinate with soy sauce, garlic, and ginger
Heat oil in a wok or skillet over high heat
Stir-fry marinated beef until browned and cooked through
Add sliced vegetables (such as bell peppers, onions, and broccoli) to the wok and stir-fry until tender-crisp
Return the beef to the wok, add stir-fry sauce, and toss to combine
Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease and flour cake pans
Mix together flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, baking soda, and salt in a bowl
Cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy
Beat in eggs, one at a time, followed by vanilla extract
Alternate adding dry ingredients and milk to the batter, mixing until smooth
Divide the batter evenly between the cake pans and bake until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean
Let the cakes cool completely before frosting
Soak chickpeas in water overnight, then drain and rinse
Combine soaked chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, cumin, coriander, and salt in a food processor
Process until the mixture forms a coarse paste
Shape the mixture into balls or patties
Fry the falafel in hot oil until golden brown and crispy
Preheat the oven to 350°F (175°C) and grease a baking dish
Mix together flour, sugar, and salt in a bowl
Cut in cold butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs
Press the mixture into the bottom of the prepared baking dish
Bake until golden brown, then remove from the oven and let cool slightly
Meanwhile, whisk together eggs, sugar, lemon juice, and lemon zest until smooth
Pour the lemon mixture over the baked crust and return to the oven
Bake until the filling is set, then let cool completely before cutting into bars
Cook pasta according to package instructions, then drain and set aside
Heat olive oil and butter in a skillet over medium heat
Add minced garlic and cook until fragrant
Add shrimp to the skillet and cook until pink and opaque
Stir in white wine, lemon juice, and red pepper flakes
Add cooked pasta to the skillet and toss to coat in the sauce
Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley and grated Parmesan cheese
Season ground beef with taco seasoning and cook in a skillet until browned
Warm taco shells in the oven or microwave
Fill taco shells with cooked beef and desired toppings (such as lettuce, cheese, tomatoes, and salsa)
Serve hot, with lime wedges on the side
Spread Dijon mustard on slices of bread
Top half of the bread slices with sliced ham and grated Gruyère cheese
Cover with the remaining bread slices to make sandwiches
Spread butter on the outside of each sandwich
Place the sandwiches on a baking sheet and bake until golden brown and crispy
Cook chicken breasts until fully cooked, then shred with forks
Mix shredded chicken with enchilada sauce and diced green chilies
Warm corn tortillas in the microwave or on the stovetop
Spoon chicken mixture into each tortilla, roll up, and place seam-side down in a baking dish
Pour additional enchilada sauce over the top of the enchiladas
Sprinkle shredded cheese over the top and bake until cheese is melted and bubbly
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C) and line a muffin tin with paper liners
In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt
In a separate bowl, mix together milk, oil, and eggs
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and stir until just combined
Gently fold in fresh or frozen blueberries
Divide batter evenly among muffin cups and bake until golden brown and a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean
Soak wide rice noodles in warm water for 30 minutes
Heat oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat
Add minced garlic and chopped Chinese broccoli stems, cook until fragrant
Add sliced chicken or tofu, cook until browned
Push chicken or tofu to one side of the wok, crack eggs into the empty space
Scramble eggs until cooked through, then mix with chicken or tofu
Pour in soy sauce, oyster sauce, and dark soy sauce, toss until noodles are evenly coated
Add Chinese broccoli leaves and stir-fry until wilted
Cook ground meat with onions, carrots, and peas until browned
Transfer the cooked meat mixture to a baking dish
Spread mashed potatoes over the top of the meat mixture
Bake in the preheated oven until the mashed potatoes are golden brown and the filling is bubbling
Drain canned tuna and flake it with a fork
Mix tuna with mayonnaise, diced celery, diced red onion, and chopped pickles
Season with salt, pepper, and lemon juice to taste
Spread tuna salad on bread slices and assemble sandwiches
Bring water or dashi stock to a simmer in a pot
Dissolve miso paste in a small amount of hot water, then add it to the pot
Add diced tofu, sliced green onions, and seaweed to the soup
Simmer for a few minutes until heated through
Mix together graham cracker crumbs, sugar, and melted butter
Press the crumb mixture into the bottom of a pie dish
Bake the crust until set, then let it cool completely
In a bowl, whisk together sweetened condensed milk, key lime juice, and egg yolks
Pour the filling into the cooled crust and bake until set
Let the pie cool, then refrigerate until chilled
Marinate chicken pieces in yogurt, lemon juice, and spices for 1 hour
Grill or broil chicken until cooked through
Heat oil in a skillet and sauté onions, garlic, and ginger until softened
Add tomato sauce, cream, and spices to the skillet
Simmer the sauce until thickened, then add cooked chicken
Serve hot with rice and naan bread
Preheat the oven to 325°F (160°C)
Sauté bacon in a Dutch oven until crispy, then remove and set aside
Brown beef cubes in batches in the bacon fat
Remove beef and sauté onions, carrots, and garlic until softened
Deglaze the pot with red wine, scraping up any browned bits
Return beef and bacon to the pot, add beef broth, tomato paste, and herbs
Cover and bake in the preheated oven until beef is tender
Butter a soufflé dish and coat with grated Parmesan cheese
Melt butter in a saucepan, then whisk in flour to make a roux
Gradually whisk in warm milk until smooth and thickened
Remove from heat and stir in grated cheese until melted
Beat egg yolks and fold into the cheese mixture
In a clean bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form
Gently fold egg whites into the cheese mixture
Pour the mixture into the prepared soufflé dish and bake until puffed and golden
Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C)
Mix together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt in a bowl
Stir in dried fruit or chocolate chips, if desired
Beat together egg and milk, then add to the dry ingredients
Mix until just combined, then turn out onto a floured surface and knead briefly
Pat the dough into a circle and cut into wedges
Place scones on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper and bake until golden brown
Slice ripe tomatoes and fresh mozzarella cheese into rounds
Arrange tomato and mozzarella slices on a plate, alternating and overlapping
Tuck fresh basil leaves between the tomato and mozzarella slices
Drizzle with balsamic glaze and olive oil
Sprinkle with salt and pepper to taste
Thinly slice beef and marinate in soy sauce, sugar, sesame oil, garlic, and ginger for 1-2 hours
Heat a skillet or grill pan over high heat
Cook marinated beef in batches until browned and caramelized
Serve hot with steamed rice and vegetables
Bring chicken broth to a simmer in a large pot
Add diced chicken, carrots, celery, and onion to the pot
Simmer until chicken is cooked through and vegetables are tender
Add cooked noodles to the pot and season with salt, pepper, and herbs
Heat heavy cream until hot but not boiling
Pour hot cream over chopped chocolate and let it sit for a few minutes
Stir until smooth and glossy, then refrigerate until firm
Roll chocolate mixture into balls and coat with cocoa powder, powdered sugar, or chopped nuts
Warm tortillas in a skillet or oven
Cook eggs to your preference (fried, scrambled, or poached)
Top each tortilla with refried beans, cooked eggs, and salsa
Garnish with chopped cilantro, avocado slices, and grated cheese
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat
Sauté onions and garlic until softened
Add diced eggplant, zucchini, bell peppers, and tomatoes to the skillet
Season with salt, pepper, and herbs de Provence
Simmer until vegetables are tender and flavors are blended
Prepare falafel mixture by blending chickpeas, herbs, spices, and flour in a food processor
Shape falafel mixture into balls or patties and fry until golden brown and crispy
Warm flatbread in the oven or on a skillet
Assemble falafel wrap with flatbread, falafel, lettuce, tomatoes, cucumbers, and tahini sauce
Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then dredge in flour
Heat olive oil and butter in a skillet over medium-high heat
Sear chicken breasts until golden brown on both sides
Remove chicken from skillet and set aside
Add minced garlic to the skillet and cook until fragrant
Deglaze the skillet with white wine and chicken broth, scraping up any browned bits
Add lemon juice, capers, and lemon slices to the skillet
Return chicken to the skillet and simmer until cooked through
Add sliced vegetables (such as bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, and snow peas) to the wok
Stir-fry until vegetables are tender-crisp
Season with soy sauce, garlic, ginger, and any other desired seasonings
Serve hot over rice or noodles
Season chicken breasts with salt, pepper, and garlic powder
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium-high heat
Sear chicken breasts until golden brown on both sides and cooked through
Melt butter in the skillet, then add minced garlic and cook until fragrant
Stir in heavy cream, grated Parmesan cheese, and salt and pepper to taste
Simmer until the sauce thickens, then toss with cooked pasta
Slice cooked chicken and serve over the Alfredo pasta
Cut croissants into cubes and place them in a greased baking dish
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, sugar, vanilla extract, and cinnamon
Pour the egg mixture over the croissants, pressing down to ensure they are fully soaked
Bake in the preheated oven until golden brown and set
Serve warm with a dusting of powdered sugar or a drizzle of caramel sauce
Cook spaghetti in a large pot of boiling salted water until al dente, then drain and set aside
Cook diced pancetta or bacon in a skillet until crispy
Remove cooked pancetta from the skillet and set aside
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated Parmesan cheese, and black pepper
Toss cooked spaghetti with the egg mixture until evenly coated
Add cooked pancetta to the skillet, then pour the spaghetti and egg mixture over it
Cook over low heat, tossing constantly, until the sauce thickens and coats the pasta
Marinate chicken thighs in yogurt, lemon juice, garlic, and spices for 1-2 hours
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-high heat
Cook marinated chicken thighs until browned and cooked through
Slice cooked chicken and serve in pita bread with lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and tahini sauce
Grease and flour cake pans
In a bowl, sift together flour, cocoa powder, baking soda, and salt
In another bowl, cream together butter and sugar until light and fluffy
Beat in eggs, one at a time, then stir in vanilla extract and red food coloring
Alternate adding dry ingredients and buttermilk to the batter, mixing until smooth
Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C)
Roll out pizza dough on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper
Drizzle olive oil over the flatbread and sprinkle with salt
Bake in the preheated oven until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is bubbly
Heat pita bread in the oven or on a skillet until warm and pliable
Slice cooked gyro meat thinly
Assemble gyro wrap with warm pita bread, gyro meat, lettuce, tomatoes, onions, and tzatziki sauce
In a food processor, blend fresh basil, pine nuts, garlic, Parmesan cheese, and olive oil until smooth
Toss cooked pasta with pesto sauce until evenly coated
Serve hot, garnished with additional Parmesan cheese and pine nuts if desired
Season chicken breasts with salt and pepper, then grill or bake until cooked through
Slice cooked chicken thinly
Warm tortillas in the oven or on a skillet until pliable
Assemble Caesar wrap with warm tortillas, sliced chicken, romaine lettuce, Parmesan cheese, and Caesar dressing
Heat olive oil and butter in a large skillet over medium heat
Sauté diced onions and minced garlic until softened
Add Arborio rice to the skillet and toast until lightly golden
Deglaze the skillet with white wine, stirring constantly until absorbed
Add hot chicken or vegetable broth to the skillet, one ladleful at a time, stirring constantly until absorbed
Stir in sliced mushrooms and cook until tender
Stir in grated Parmesan cheese, salt, and pepper to taste
Serve hot, garnished with chopped parsley if desired
Toast bread until golden brown and crisp
Mash ripe avocados with a fork and spread over the toasted bread
Season with salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes to taste
Drizzle with olive oil and sprinkle with sesame seeds or chopped cilantro if desired
Heat a skillet over medium heat
Place a tortilla in the skillet and sprinkle with shredded cheese
Arrange cooked chicken, sliced peppers, onions, and any other desired fillings over the cheese
Top with another tortilla and cook until the bottom tortilla is golden brown and crispy
Flip the quesadilla and cook until the other side is golden brown and crispy
Slice into wedges and serve hot, with salsa and sour cream on the side
Heat butter and olive oil in a large pot over medium heat
Add thinly sliced onions and cook until caramelized
Stir in flour and cook for 2 minutes
Deglaze the pot with white wine, scraping up any browned bits
Add beef broth, thyme, bay leaf, and salt and pepper to taste
Simmer for 20-30 minutes
Toast baguette slices in the oven until crisp
Ladle soup into oven-safe bowls, top with baguette slices and shredded Gruyère cheese
Broil until the cheese is melted and bubbly
In a bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt
In another bowl, mix together ricotta cheese, milk, lemon juice, lemon zest, egg yolks, and melted butter
Beat egg whites until stiff peaks form
Gently fold egg whites into the ricotta mixture
Heat a skillet or griddle over medium heat and lightly grease with butter or oil
Pour batter onto the skillet to form pancakes and cook until golden brown on both sides
Preheat oven to 160°C (320°F) and grease and flour a round cake pan
Beat eggs and sugar until pale, thick, and tripled in volume
Sift flour into egg mixture in batches, gently folding after each
Fold in vanilla extract
Pour batter into prepared pan and smooth the top
Bake for 25-30 minutes until golden and a toothpick comes out clean
Cool in pan for 10 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack
Rinse the clams under cold water to remove any sand or grit. Discard any clams with broken shells or that do not close when tapped
In a large skillet or pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant
Add the clams to the skillet and pour in the white wine. Cover the skillet with a lid and cook for 5-7 minutes, or until the clams have opened
Discard any clams that have not opened. Sprinkle the chopped coriander over the clams and season with salt and black pepper to taste
Give everything a gentle toss to combine
Transfer the clams and sauce to a serving dish. Serve hot with lemon wedges on the side for squeezing over the clams
Preheat your oven to 200°C (390°F).Grease a muffin tin or line it with paper liners
In a large mixing bowl, combine the granulated sugar and melted butter. Mix well
Add the eggs, one at a time, mixing well after each addition
Gradually add the flour, mixing until smooth
Stir in the whole milk and lemon zest until well combined
Pour the batter into the prepared muffin tin, filling each cavity about 3/4 full
Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until the queijadas are set and golden brown on top
Remove from the oven and let them cool in the tin for 10 minutes before transferring them to a wire rack to cool completely
Once cooled, dust the queijadas with ground cinnamon
Heat the vegetable oil in a large skillet or wok over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and chopped onion, and sauté until fragrant, about 2 minutes
Add the cooked chicken, shrimp, or tofu (if using) to the skillet, and stir-fry for another 2-3 minutes until heated through
Push the ingredients to one side of the skillet, and pour the beaten eggs onto the empty side. Allow the eggs to set slightly, then scramble them until cooked
Add the cooked rice to the skillet, breaking up any clumps with a spoon or spatula. Stir-fry for 3-4 minutes to heat through and incorporate all the ingredients
Add the kecap manis, soy sauce, and oyster sauce to the skillet, and toss everything together until well combined
Season with salt and pepper to taste, and adjust the seasoning if necessary
Serve the Nasi Goreng hot, garnished with sliced cucumber, tomato, lettuce, and fried shallots if desired
Serve with lime wedges on the side for squeezing over the Nasi Goreng
Mix garlic, shallot, kecap manis, soy sauce, oil, spices, salt for marinade
Marinate chicken in the mixture for 1 hour or more
Thread chicken onto skewers
Preheat grill, cook skewers 4-5 min each side until cooked through
Brush with marinade while grilling
Serve hot with sambal or peanut sauce, cucumber, and onion slices
Preheat the oven to 180°C (350°F)
Blend shallots, garlic, chili peppers, candlenuts, lemongrass, ginger, turmeric, galangal, kaffir lime leaves, and shrimp paste into a smooth paste
Rub the spice paste all over the suckling pig, including inside the cavity
Truss the pig and place it on a roasting rack in a roasting pan. Brush with vegetable oil
Roast the pig in the preheated oven for 3-4 hours, or until the skin is crispy and golden brown, and the meat is tender
Once cooked, remove the pig from the oven and let it rest for 20-30 minutes before carving
Carve the pig into serving pieces and serve hot with steamed rice and sambal matah
Heat olive oil in a large paella pan or skillet
Sauté onion and garlic until softened
Add bell peppers and tomato, cook until peppers are tender
Stir in chorizo and chicken, cook until chicken is browned
Add rice, smoked paprika, and saffron. Cook for 1 minute
Pour in chicken broth and bring to a simmer. Cook uncovered for 15-20 minutes until rice is almost cooked
Arrange seafood mix over the rice. Cook for another 5-10 minutes until seafood is cooked through and rice is tender
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Serve hot with lemon wedges
In a saucepan, heat water, sugar, vegetable oil, and salt until boiling
Remove from heat and stir in flour until mixture forms a ball
Heat vegetable oil in a deep frying pan or pot
Pipe or spoon dough into hot oil, fry until golden brown
Drain on paper towels
Mix sugar and cinnamon in a shallow bowl
Roll churros in cinnamon sugar mixture
Preheat the grill to medium-high heat
Season the beef ribs generously with salt and pepper
Place the ribs on the grill and cook for 5-7 minutes on each side, or until desired doneness
Remove from the grill and let the meat rest for a few minutes
Serve hot with chimichurri sauce on the side
In a bowl, mix flour and salt
Add cold water and diced butter to the flour mixture
Mix until a dough forms
Roll out the dough on a floured surface and cut out circles
Place a spoonful of filling in the center of each circle
Fold the dough over the filling to form a half-moon shape
Seal the edges by crimping with a fork
Brush the empanadas with egg wash
Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (400°F) for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown
Drain and rinse the beans
In a large pot, heat vegetable oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, cook until softened
Add mixed meats to the pot and cook until browned
Add black beans, bay leaves, and enough water to cover the ingredients. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer for 1-2 hours, or until beans are tender
Season with salt and pepper to taste
Serve hot with rice and orange slices on the side
In a non-stick saucepan, combine sweetened condensed milk, cocoa powder, and butter
Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens and pulls away from the sides of the pan (about 10-15 minutes)
Remove from heat and let the mixture cool to room temperature
Grease your hands with butter and roll the mixture into small balls (about 1 tablespoon each)
Roll the balls in chocolate sprinkles or grated chocolate to coat
In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion, garlic, carrots, and celery, cook until softened
Add beef chunks to the pot and brown on all sides
Stir in tomato paste and cook for 2-3 minutes
Pour in red wine, beef broth, red wine vinegar, and add bay leaves. Bring to a simmer, then cover and cook over low heat for 2-3 hours, or until the meat is tender
Season with salt, pepper, and sugar to taste, then serve hot with gnocchi or pasta
In a mixing bowl, combine flour, instant yeast, sugar, and salt
Add the egg, milk, and citrus zest to the dry ingredients. Mix until smooth
If using raisins, fold them into the batter
Cover the bowl with a clean kitchen towel and let the batter rise in a warm place for about 30 minutes
Heat vegetable oil in a deep pot or fryer to 170°C (340°F)
Drop spoonfuls of batter into the hot oil and fry until golden brown and cooked through, about 2-3 minutes per side
Remove the fritters from the oil and drain on paper towels, then dust with powdered sugar while still warm
